Class Validations

  • java.lang.Object
    • Validations

  • public class Validations
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all validations for necessary methods of the program.

      • checkRange

        public static void checkRange(int min,
                              int max,
                              int num)
                       throws DeviceExceptions.InvalidCommandException
        Checks the number, is in range.
        Parameters:
        min - An Integer that represents minimum number that num param can be.
        max - An Integer that represents maximum number that num param can be.
        num - An Integer that is going to check.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions.InvalidCommandException - if is not in range, it gives an error.

                             throws DeviceExceptions.MissingArgumentException
        Checks the there is missing arguments in a list.
        Parameters:
        values - An ArrayList.
        indexes - int... varargs that represents the indexes that is wanted to check.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions.MissingArgumentException - If there is a missing argument, gives an error.

        Throws:

        Throws:

      • validateStatus

        public static void validateStatus(java.lang.String statusStr)
                           throws DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks the status of the SmartDevice.
        Parameters:
        statusStr - A String : status of the device.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException - If the status exist and different from "On" or "Off", it gives an error.

      • validateAmpere

        public static void validateAmpere(java.lang.String ampereStr)
                           throws DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks the ampere of the SmartPlug.
        Parameters:
        ampereStr - A String : ampere of the plugged device.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException - If the ampere exist and not can be a float number or not positive, it gives an error.

      • validateKelvin

        public static void validateKelvin(java.lang.String kelvinStr)
                           throws DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks the kelvin of the SmartLamp.
        Parameters:
        kelvinStr - A String : kelvin value of the device.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException - If the kelvin exist and not can be an integer or not range in 2000-6000, it gives an error.

      • validateBrightness

        public static void validateBrightness(java.lang.String brightnessStr)
                               throws DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks the brightness of the SmartLamp.
        Parameters:
        brightnessStr - A String : brightness value of the device.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException - If the brightness exist and not can be an integer or not range in 0-100, it gives an error.

      • validateColorCode

        public static void validateColorCode(java.lang.String colorCodeStr)
                              throws DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks the color code of the SmartColorLamp.
        Parameters:
        colorCodeStr - A String : color code of the device.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException - If the color code exist and not in true color code format, it gives an error.

      • validateMegabyte

        public static void validateMegabyte(java.lang.String megabyteStr)
                             throws DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks the megabyte of the SmartPlug.
        Parameters:
        megabyteStr - A String : megabyte of the plugged device.
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions.IllegalArgumentException - If the megabyte not exist or not can be a float number or not positive, it gives an error.

      • validateAction

        public static void validateAction(Action action)
                           throws DeviceExceptions.InvalidCommandException
        Checks the Action.actionName is a valid action in this program.
        Parameters:
        action - An Action from user
        Throws:
        DeviceExceptions.InvalidCommandException - If the action name is not in SmartDeviceController.methodMapper, gives an error.
